Howdy,

Is anyone aware of a JUnit extension for internationalization tests? 
I'm looking for something data-driven along the lines of:

   for $locale in $locales
     setLocale($locale)
     let $expectedLocalizedWord1 := localizedWord(englishWord1, $locale)
     assertEquals($expectedLocalizedWord1, actualChunkOfText1);
     let $expectedLocalizedWord2 := localizedWord(englishWord2, $locale)
     assertEquals($expectedLocalizedWord2, actualChunkOfText2);
     ...

Localized words could be stored in resource bundles or equivalent.  This 
test could then be layered atop HtmlUnit/HttpUnit, for example.  That 
is, ideally I'd like to test the contents of a web page for all 
supported locales in one fell swoop.  Think: BabelFishTest.

It seems relatively straightforward to implement, but I wanted to cull 
for ideas before considering building yet another something 'er other.

Thanks!
